snippet: A prosecutor said David Tarloff’s preparations and his escape showed that “he knew what he was doing” when he killed a psychologist, Kathryn Faughey.
abstract: Frame of mind of David Tarloff at the moment he waited in stairwell to rob Kathryn Faughey at her Upper East Side office in 2008 will be core issue in his murder trial; Faughey is accused of stabbing to death Faughey, his former psychiatrist, but defense is seeking to prove Tarloff was not responsible for crime because of mental illness.
lead_paragraph: A prosecutor said David Tarloff’s preparations and his escape showed that “he knew what he was doing” when he killed a psychologist, Kathryn Faughey.

headline.seo: Trial in Killing of Therapist Will Hinge on Defendant’s Mind-Set
headline.main: Trial of a Therapist’s Killer Will Hinge on Frame of Mind
headline.print_headline: Trial of a Therapist’s Killer Will Hinge on Frame of Mind
